result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy E. Monroe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo AODA assessment and any other counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it. Not to go to taverns/bars/liquor stores or any business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  No possession of alcohol.  Random UA's per agent.  Seek and maintain full-time employment.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

11:16 AM Defendant Jeremy E. Monroe in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Jeremy E. Monroe.  Attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for State of Wisconsin.  State states joint recommendation.  State requests additional time regarding jail credit.  Atty Frank agrees.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Counts 2 - 6: Dismissed but read in 

Count 1:

3 years Probation

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

Provide DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
No possession of alcohol
No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it and must be reported to agent within 24 hours
Random UA's per agent
Seek and maintain full-time employment
$518.00 Fine/Costs fees (PAID THRU SAUK CO. CLERK OF COURTS), 60 days to pay or set up a payment with the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts
